title: case sensitive user name folders causing files to disappear
body:
i'm using owncloud 4.5.6 on a debian machine and had the problem that my files disappeared in the web interface after an update (i have no idea which update, sorry) but were still available on the file system and also in the database.

browsing to /remote.php/webdav/ showed me an empty list and calling the javascript function scanfiles() on the files page didn't find any files either.
i checked the chmod settings, but there were still no files. when going through the data folder, i noticed that for my user rio (notice the capital letter), there were suddenly two folders: rio and rio. 
after removing the lower case user name folder and refreshing the files page, it recreated the lower case folder. i removed the lower case folder again and created a link from rio to rio which solved my problem: webdav showed me my files again and after calling scanfiles() the files page also updated and my files were back. 

the database contains the capitalized user name in the users and the fscache table and both tables have a case insensitive collation.

it seems like the files page is screwing something up, because after removing the link to the correct folder, webdav works fine but after refreshing the files page, it creates the lower case folder again and webdav stops working.
